title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2101.2 - Maximum rents for housing accommodations in hotels
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2101.2 - Maximum rents for housing accommodations in hotels

State Regulations

In the City of Buffalo, the maximum rent payable by any
hotel tenant is the rent established on March 1, 1950 by Local Law No. 3 of the

City of Buffalo for the year 1947. This shall include any adjustment granted by
the Temporary City Housing Rent Commission of the City of Buffalo pursuant to
the provisions of the said local law; except that where there was no maximum
rent established by such local law on March 1, 1950, the maximum rent payable
by any hotel tenant shall be the amount of rent payable on that
date. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2101.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
